name: Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I must say that I this was an absolute breath of fresh air! It pains me to even tell you why I'm writing a review because I don't want this one thing to deter you from staying and I should not. We checked in at about 3pm on August 15 after traveling from New York since 4:30AM. We were hungry and wanted to enjoy a nice Caribbean lunch in the hotel restaurant "LA VISTA". We were seated outside on the terrace as requested and ordered two delicious mojitos right away. Followed by this we got Ceviche as an appetizer and proceeded to order our main courses from a slim menu. I got the Cuban sandwich and my fiancée ordered a grilled Caribbean mango chicken sandwich. $70 later plus tip, I have to tell you how disappointing this food was. I really had higher expectations of a Marriott resort restaurant. The bread was not fresh and the sandwiches looked and tasted like they came out of a school cafeteria! We got engaged on the Beach outside the hotel the next day and went to dinner down the street at an Argentinean restaurant. I'm sure we would have, as we planned, eaten in the Marriott Tuscany restaurant for dinner that night. But we didn’t. Nor did we order breakfast to the room the next morning to eat on the balcony while watching waves crash as we planned due to our lunch experience on day one.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel, staff, casino, bar, club scene, pools, and especially the beaches were all stellar! We loved this hotel! It was a fairy tale engagement vacation and I would highly recommend going there. The staff was always smiling, always attentive, and so very helpful. The food was well below the bar that I would expect of a Marriott Hotel / Resort. We would have probably eaten at the hotel several more times, but lucky for us, the street just outside the hotel is packed full of great restaurants!
reviews.title: High Expectations Not Met

likes.liked: — The room, balcony, and one of the staff members.
likes.disliked: — The service, pool, restaurants, casino and lobby

reviews.text: I had very high expectations of this hotel due to its high ranking on tripadvisor, four diamond ranking, and the fact that it is a Marriott corporate run hotel rather than a franchise. My high expectations were not met for the following reasons. The day I was to fly out, I spoke with Anthony in at your service (hotel operator) to inquire if the wireless in guest room internet charge was included in the $29 a day resort fee that is charged on top of the room rate and tax. Anthony told me this internet charge was included. I arrived at the hotel around 2AM, and there was a band playing music in a dance club type atmosphere in the middle of what is supposed to be the hotel lobby, which was made up of a bunch of tables and chairs with a bar in the middle. I couldn't hear a thing because of the volume of the music, and there were no front desk employees at the front desk. After a few minutes, I tracked a hotel employee down, and was eventually checked into my room. Upon arriving at my guest room for the first time, I was greeted by a small amount of trash right in front of my guest room door in the hallway. After entering the guest room, I was happy to see that the room was clean and in good shape. The room I stayed in was recently renovated and had a very nice formal caribbean decor. The balcony was large for a standard guest room, and was extremely private, which blocked off a portion of our ocean front view, but the privacy was nice. After getting settled, I went to go on the internet, and the computer showed that I would be charged an additional $14.95 a day for internet access, so I called at your service again, and was told that I would not be charged the additional fee, because it was included in my resort fee. The next day we were out of the room the whole day until 6 or 7PM, and when we arrived at the room it was still dirty, because housekeeping had not come by to clean the room yet. I called at your service, and was told that housekeeping could only bring me towels at this time of the evening, and instead of arguing with this person, I asked to speak to a manager. I was put in contact with Miguel, who is a housekeeping manager. Miguel initially did not know why my room was not cleaned, but eventually told me that the maid got sick and went home early. Shortly after that conversation, my room was cleaned. On my way to the casino that night, I stopped by the front desk to speak to a manager to try to get some assurance that I would not have many more problems, because we were ready to switch to another hotel at that point. I spoke to a woman, who claimed to be a manager, and when I told her about the problems we had on our first day and that we were thinking about changing hotels instead of apologizing or addressing the problems, she offered to book us in another hotel. After I told her that I would think about whether we would stay or not, she gave me a "I'm sorry". I then proceeded to the casino in the hotel, and was previously told by a person at the front desk that no shorts or short sleeves were allowed to be worn in the casino at night, so I was in jeans and a button down shirt. After about an hour, I could not tolerate how hot I was in the casino, because the air conditioning is kept very low, so I left the casino and never returned during the entire trip. I believe it was the second night of our trip, and we went to La Vista, which I was told was the casual dinner restaurant of the hotel, and the food was very slow to come out even though there were only a hand full of people in the entire restaurant. I asked the waitress for the check, and she must have forgot, because we had to eventually get up and wait for her by the server's area to pay the check and leave. On our second to last night, we did not receive maid service again, but this time it was just turndown service we did not receive, so our bed was made and the room was clean, but we had no clean towels or shampoo that night and the next morning. Sure enough on our last day, we look at the bill and there were multiple internet charges on top of the resort fees. This time my girlfriend went down to the front desk to get the internet charges taken off the bill. Upon her return to the room, she told me she successfully had them take off the internet charges and that we were being treated to a complimentary breakfast by Marco, who was briefed on the details of our stay. I had a chance to meet and speak to Marco before we checked out, and he was very apologetic and was a pleasure to speak with. I have to say that when the maids cleaned our room they did an excellent job and were very nice when we encountered them. During our stay we spent a good amount of time eating and having drinks at the Marriott Renaissance, which is only a couple of blocks away. The Renaissance was booked up the night that the front desk manager offered to transfer me to another hotel, so we ended up staying at the Marriott. Anyway, we very much enjoyed our time at the Renaissance. The Renaissance is a much more chic and beautiful hotel. It has an art deco decor with lots of water features, colored lighting, and comfy white beds and couches all over the lobby and pool area. The Renaissance restaurants are excellent as well, and are not your typical Marriott restaurants. The service we experienced at the Renaissance when dining there was excellent. Although, we had a good time in Puerto Rico overall despite some problems, we would probably not go back to Puerto Rico again; However, if we did go back we would definitely try the Renaissance and stay away from the Marriott.
reviews.title: Great hotel in Old San Juan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family of 4 had a fantastic stay at the Marriott in San Juan. The staff were extremely helpful and eager to please. We made several requests of the front desk staff or concierge, and all were very responsive to our needs.
reviews.title: Very friendly and accommodating

likes.liked: — Very clean and comfortable; great bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are up-to-date, clean, and more than adequate size for a family of 4. We really liked the pool, but at times during the day it can get rather crowded. Our room had a great balcony, with a view of the pool. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for the beaches, the surf is rough here, but the beach is still nice for taking a walk. This hotel is a nice area of San Juan. We never felt uneasy when walking in the neighborhood, even late in the evening. There is a very prominent police prescence in Old San Juan, and the neighborhood around the hotel. The hotel is a short cab ride to the historic area of Old San Juan. The concierge is a great resource when planning your site-seeing around San Juan or beyond. The concierge can also provide a list of local restaurants, of which there are many choices nearby.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Okay Location
Very Pleased With This Hotel
reviews.text: Had a great stay in mid-March 2004. We were on the 19th floor with a half-ocean, half-city view. The room was always clean, but was small, with a comfortable bed and furnishings. Yes, the lobby rocks on weekend nights, and we stopped briefly to watch the dancing, though no one can talk above the music. However, we could not hear the lobby or casino sounds on our floor or in our room. Food in the Vista restaurant was very good; we did not try Anthony's. The lobby coffee shop makes excellent sandwiches and has great pasteries--at a fair price. There are many excellent restaurants within a block or two, a Walgreen's yards away for necessities, and a bus stop outside the hotel for the 15-minute (25 cents) ride to the old city. Every staff person we encountered was gracious, many asking whether there was anything we needed. The pool area was busy, but we always found lounge chairs somewhere. The large fountain pool, one of two pools, helps mask the people sounds, making poolside snoozes easy. Forget the hotel promo that you can swim laps in the pool; you can't. We stayed during very windy weather, so beach swimming was impossible. My only complaint is the amount of litter on the beach during the day; I blame careless guests. The beach is cleaned nightly. As other reviewers note, the Condado area has several derelict hotels, the lasting result of a devastating hurricane a few years ago. But elegant shops and a wide variety of restaurants on tree-lined Condado streets make up for a few blighted and under-construction areas. We would definitely go back.

reviews.title: Great Vacation!!
reviews.text: My friends and I spent a week at the Marriott in San Juan and we loved it!! We enjoyed the beach and the hotel itself and had tons of fun! It was near everthing and the best part was it was between Old San Juan and Isla Verde (which are two great places to visit). I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

This place may have been renovated, but service levels are awful. Booded 2 oceanfront corner pool/ocean rooms @ 280 per night + 10% resort fee. Internet was down most of the time and wireless-only service is non-reliable and fails constantly. All guests in the hotel who had computers were complaining. Hotel staff clueless as to what to do. They would transfer me to a toll-free 800 number that went to India only to be put on hold for 20 mins before I was told an storm in Atlanta had caused "global" outages for the "StayOnline" (ironic name, right?) service. My comapny headquaters are in Atlanta and when I called the office, we were up and no major thuderstorms in the area. The hotel was just using this as an excuse. No major hotel, and especially one that caters to convention/business travelors should have such poor technical services in a newly renovated room. Drinks in the executive lounge are $8.50+ for serve-yourself bar. Security at the hotel is terrible. Anyone from the street can access the elevators and there were two security situations that had to be addressed on my floor during my 5-night stay. Sign-in within the executive club is also very unsecure and receptionists regularly would repeat guests name and room number when they walked in.....not a good idea in today's environment! In addiition, sign-in book is left laying out for all guest coming in to see. Hotel operators are responsible for handling calls to all areas of the hotel (ex. no "front desk" button on the ohones) and they often will disconnect or put you on hold forever before coming back to explain that no one is available. This Marriott has a great location but service it terrible. Rooms are nice now, but AC is either too cold/too hot 24 hrs a day. This hotel has had a facelift but nothing major. Business people will be majorly disappointed and families will be turned off by the price. All will be disappointed at the level of general service and staff competence. SJU needs a true 5-star property with consistent, reliable services. I have stayed at this Marriott many times over the years and sadly nothing has changed other than a badly needed room renovation. Guests paying these prices expect to receive more. Having to beg someone to setup an umbrella on the beach was also frustrating. Unfortnately, this is about the norm in SJU. Oh well, I tried it....again. Management has major issues to overcome at this property.
reviews.title: Serivce Awful. Internet Down 1/2 of the Time

likes.disliked: — General service. Terrrible internet service, business services. Internet down constantly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the Marriott...
reviews.title: Loved the Marriott

reviews.text: We got the Marriott on priceline for $115/night. When we arrived, the desk staff were extremely helpful. Having read the reviews on tripadvisor, we asked for an upgrade to a corner room...They told us oceanfront room would be $50 more/night and the corner room even more. We sighed b/c we really didn't want to spend that much and agreed only to the extra $50/night for the ocean front room. When the front desk attendant came back she said she had a nice surprise for us and gave us the corner room anyway (for $50/night) on the 18th floor. The view was gorgeous. The room has flatscreen tv, two balconies (one ocean front, one overlooking the pool), new king size bed, etc. Very nice.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, the upgrade came with access to the executive lounge on the top floor which included free breakfast, evening snacks (which actually served as our dinner on more than one occasion), and dessert. The food was also very good up there and we almost ate enough to pay for the extra $50 upgrade.
reviews.title: Great Oceanfront, corner room - spacious

reviews.text: The pool is somewhat geared towards families....we are two gay guys in our late 20s/early 30s so we ventured toward the beach. They will carry your lounge chairs and umbrella to where you want. One guy from the hotel came to the beach and gave us fruit (for free) while we were sunning ourselves and there were usually people around to take our drink orders. Otherwise, we just went out up to the pool/beach bar and got our own. I must have been at a different beach than some people who reviewed this hotel b/c i found the beach very nice, the waves calm (minimal waves....they always have this red flag warning you of the surf, but it is really nothing....everyone was swimming, including little two and three year olds..no big deal).
reviews.title: Horrible Experience at this resort - left after the first night!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wife and I spent 4 nights here in June 2008. Overall we had a great trip. We ate at the hotel several times and had a good experience each time.
reviews.title: Great Overall - I wish I had known the beach shuts down at 7:00pm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing I wish I had known is that they close the beach and beach bar down at 7:00. I usually enjoy the time around sunset on the beach when in the Caribbean. This is definitely not the place to go for wild night life.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Our Stay!

reviews.text: The hotel site says it is close to Old San Juan. I'm not sure I would advertise a 50 minute walk as close. There is a bus stop between the hotel and Walgreens that will take you there for 75 cents.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel, great service, friendly staff

reviews.text: A couple of things to know about the bus. On the way there you are dropped off at a stop on the sidewalk. On the way back you need to catch the bus from the terminal about a block to the west from the stop. (The bus is labeled route 21b). On the way back get off at the stop in front of the Bueno Aries resteraunt (which is directly behind Walgreens). Don't ask me how I know....
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!

reviews.text: The casino is small by US standards but it is entirely smoke free. Maybe we will catch up some day.
reviews.title: Great Resort for Family

reviews.text: Just returned from 1 week April 22nd-29th. Very Nice hotel. It grew on us. The beach was better than the one at Wydm. Condado Plaza. Yes, the waves are rough, but if you rent a car and head west to Luquillo Beach...you'll have a great time. Just get there early ;-). This hotel has a great centralized location. Old San Juan is close by and has great nuevo latino restaurants, make sure you check them out! El Yunque Rainforest is the place for a hike to a gorgeous natural waterfall. Take the trail called Las Minas....you 'll never forget it. Enjoy Enjoy!
reviews.title: best beach in condado
Best Hotel in San Juan
reviews.text: This is the best hotel in San Juan, one of two with beach access. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Pool is great, beach is clean and secured. Will return.

reviews.title: Stay there
reviews.text: We just came back from on 4-14-04. The hotel and the staff was very nice, breakfast buffet was awesome too. The lobby area and pool was very nice (only thing about pool-if you don't have kids and you would like to relax at the pool, YOU CAN'T. Because it is 3.5 feet deep only and one pool is occupied all times with kids for water activities which is annoying. Beach side is not that great either, waves are too harsh. Make sure you stay on the side of the hotel called "Cabana Rooms". The other part is really old and when you pay over $260.00 it is a dissappointment for what you pay! But most definetly stay here and make sure to speak up-IF YOU DON'T LIKE YOUR ROOM!

reviews.title: A great time
reviews.text: We returned last night after spending six nights at this hotel. The staff was polite, attentive and responsive tom our needs. The location is minutes from Old San Juan and a 20 minute drive to the airport. It is in walking distance of a Walgreen's (for all your basic needs), several local eateries and also basic local shops. My family enjoyed the facilities completely, the tennis courts, pool and the beach. It is a public beach, not maintained by the hotel. All beaches on the island are public beaches. The lobby throbs (rocks) with excitement each evening. The poolside area is also filled with music on the week-ends.

reviews.title: one of the best vacations
reviews.text: The restaurants are overated but worth a try........there are alot of other choices so don't limit yourself to the hotel menus. Try Da Luigi in Santurce. Visit the Art Museum and take a trip to the rain forest.

My friend and I, very much in need of a vacation from NYC, booked a trip to San Juan. We chose the Marriott due to all the amazing reviews despite the more expensive price compared to other places on the condado strip. The Marriott exceded out expectations. In everyway.
reviews.title: amazing in everyway

likes.liked: — The staff went above and beyond
likes.disliked: — A lot of children at pool. (stick to beach during day)

reviews.text: Our flight arrived at 10 am, and even though check in wasn't until 4pm, Juan at the front desk did everything he could to get us in early and had our room ready within 30 minutes.
reviews.title: Luxury in Paradise

likes.liked: — The wonderful bed and extra large room and bath

reviews.text: We walked into the room to see the most amazing view of the atlantic. The room was super clean, the bed super comfortable and the balcony had super comfortable chairs outside.
reviews.title: Perfect location, couldn't ask for better

likes.liked: — The comfort and view of the room
likes.disliked: — Didn't get to stay long enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: About 10 minutes later, the Bell man Gabriel brought our luggage up and offfered to get us ice and asked if we needed anything from the vending machine. Wow
reviews.title: Great Experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The concierge Nancy went above and beyond to answer my 105 questions with knowledge and smiles the entire time.
reviews.title: Great stay in Marriott in April 2008

reviews.text: We just returned from a five day 30th anniversary celebration - our room made the trip worthwhile - we had room 809 - which had huge balconies overlooking the ocean and the pool - everyone at the Marriott was wonderful (except the outdoors bartenders who were smug) - we had a great formal dinner at Tuscany and a sandwich and cesar salad at the villa restaurant - the salad was great and more than enough - Please refuse the resort fee taxed on to your hotel bill - it is 10% and you will not need it - go to Cafe Angel on the main road down the street from hotel - they have great PR fare at great prices - Louis just retire there and he is a great host - have the fried cheesecake for two - it is fabulous! My husband and I rented a car (in the hotel lobby) for $40 - reserve the day before and get to the desk early the next day - we drove to Rincon - two hours away but worth the trip - it was easy to follow the directions but remember the turns for the trip back - had a great time visiting beautiful surfing beaches and saw humpback whales at the lighthouse - ate a pub meal at calypso bar and talked to many Long Island surfers - many were FDNY! It was a fun time - the best meal however (for me) was the eggplant and spinach wrap at the hotel's coffee bar - take it to the pool for a great lunch -
reviews.title: Had a geat time

reviews.text: This hotel was great for a long weekend. I thought the service was terrific - they did everything you wanted them to do (placed beach chairs, gave recommendations, made reservations, brought room service, check in/out) and did it efficiently! The food in the hotel was actually quite delicious - as were the drinks. Very nice beach with beach and poolside drink/food service.
reviews.title: Great for a long weekend (note resort fee)

reviews.text: My only complaint is a hidden (in their check-in materials, apparently) resort fee. Not appropriate when you are already paying that price for a not-top hotel - and why else are you there except for the resort? You should be aware of that and figure it into your budget OR try and negotiate with them when you book the room.
reviews.title: save your money

reviews.text: My husband and I went to Puerto Rico to play golf for eight days. We stayed at the Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino and used our Marriott Rewards Points. Months before I made the reservation, I checked out the hotel on the internet and it looked very nice for a Five Star. We were very dissappointed with the hotel and the staff. The hotel should be a Three Star not a Five Star. The hotel is old and needs a lot of work. The rooms and hallways had a musty odor and the rooms are not soundproof. We stayed at many Marriotts and this was the worst. The staff were not overly friendly, nor did they go out of their way to help you. The lobby is very, very noisy because they have a band playing at night. It is very hard to carry on a conversation because of the band. I pity the staff behind the front desk with that loud noise. It must be bad for your hearing. The hotel is located in a nice section of town called Condado. If you are going to Puerto Rico to play golf do not work with the staff because they know nothing about the sport. --the courses.
reviews.title: Cattle Herders

reviews.text: My husband and I will not go back to Puerto Rico because the people were not that friendly. There are too many other places to visit again where people bend over backwards to make your stay enjoyable. For instances, Marbella, Spain, Punta Cana, D.Republic, Cancun and Puerto Vallarta.
reviews.title: Great location
Very enjoyable learning experience...
reviews.text: I just got back fron Puerto Rico on March 6 and I had a wonderful time. I stayed for 6 nights and went with my husband. Being from New York City the graffiti didnt bother me that much. The graffiti was on other property anyway. Ther is construction all over San Juan but if you think about it there is alot of construction in Times Square too, so I didnt let it bother me. The water slide was extremely fun and I was one of the few adults who kept trying it! For those complaining of the cold pool there is a perfectly good hot tub spa area almost like a jacuzzi and is very relaxing. I used it myself when the sun went down. The beach was very enjoyable and the hotel provides you with the towels and beach chairs. I got a very good tan. The waves were pretty strong for children but they were good for me it was very fun! As for the learning part of my vacation... We went to the tour desk of the hotel and bought two tours. One to El Yunque rainforest and one to go snorkeling in Ikakos island. The rainforest tour guide "YOGI" was extremely informative (ask 4 him he looks a little nuts but is very smart and sweet!) I learned about the endangered puerto rican parrot (there were lots of fake nests all over the forest to try to help them reproduce no luck yet:( Also I learned about all kinds of plants and the different uses that the Taino indians gave to them. The ride up to the rainforest was nice too. You get to see all the locals going about there business and up the mountains you get to see bulls, horses, cows and plenty of roosters. Snorkeling was a blast! I saw a beautiful white fish on the shore (I was to chicken to go deep) My husband did though and he was very impressed with the variety of fish he saw. The best part of that was the whales that we saw on our way over there it was astonishing(also very rare to see). El Morro in Old San Juan was very enjoyable to me I learned alot about the history of my country. It's like a museum. The area surroundng the hotel is very busy but I like that. I went to some expensive restuarants like Ajili Mojili (a short walk east of the hotel) the food was o.k. Then I went to a very cheap restuarant called the Godfather and the food was excellent! The hotel was great so whether youre gonna be in the hotel all day or on and about all day I think the Marriott is a very good and safe choice. Even if the hotel is not of your liking I'm sure you'll find something interesting to do in Puerto Rico. Like the night club Babylon which is very popular if thats your thing. For the younger crowd there is Club Luxor. Also, for shopaholics like me there is Plaza Las Americas which was heaven. It's one of the largest malls in all the carribean. It was fantastic. I didnt give the hotel a perfect rating because I'm sure that it's not the best but it's pretty close. Whatever you do dont let anything get you down be open and enjoy. That's what youre going on vacation for right?

reviews.title: Great
reviews.text: P.S Be sure to try some typical fried foods of Puerto Rico like Alcapurrias or Relleno de Papa if u dont mind gaing a couple extra pounds!!! ENJOY!

reviews.title: Above average Marriot.
reviews.text: My family stayed on Feb 11 the night before our cruise.

reviews.title: Good Hotel - Not Great
reviews.text: We had 4 rooms between us.

reviews.title: A Good Place to Stay
reviews.text: Service was great. Rooms very nice I had an ocean view while others in my party had partial ocean view, both very nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel as part of our Honeymoon, after we had completed a cruise. The Hotel was in very good condition, the rooms werent quite as nice as i had expected. I'd rate the decor 3.5/5 part it was very clean and tidy and the staff were great!
reviews.title: Convienient Beachfront location

reviews.text: We had breakfast included in our rate and the buffet was very substantial. The casino attached is quite small, but it seems to get a lot of customers. The bar in the lobby was fantastic, and they had salsa music and dancing one of the nights we were there.
reviews.title: My 6th stay and we plan to keep coming back!!

reviews.text: The hotel is located on a street that has lots of restasurants and places to eat. There is a walgreens about 1 monute walk away, which is like a pharmacy/supermarket - very cheap and very handy! We took a taxi to Old San Juan and this only cost us $15USD - the rate was pre-organised once we got in the cab - all taxis in San Juan seem to do this.
reviews.title: Not much of a resort, but a decent hotel.
awesome
reviews.text: Old San Juan is lovely! Its colourful and easy to navigate by yourself. I do recomend doing a proper tour for San Christobel and La Fortaliza as you will get so much more out of it than if you just look around yourselves, we combined ours with a tour of the Bacardi factory, which was really interesting!

The Hotel is right on the beach, and you can get sunloungers put on the beach for you. Unfortunatley the water was very rough when we were there, and after about 10 mins of being hit by huge waves we didnt go back in the water. The pool is ok - it is very shallow, and the swim up bar was always closed when we were there, which was a little disappointing. However there is a pretty good waterslide which all the kids at the hotel seemed to enjoy greatly. Overall we enjoyed our stay
reviews.title: Overall an OK stay

reviews.text: I stayed in an ocean view room on the 19th floor with a balcony with my sister and nephews (6 and 9yo). The room was pretty standard for a Marriott - clean, comfy and efficient. I used the fitness center (nice), the pool (very nice and the kids loved it) and the beach (very nice). Breakfast and dinner on the property were both delicious. There was definitely a happening vibe in the lobby bar and casino the night we were there. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful throughout our stay.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great beach and pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great service...everyone was very accommodating. I just thought the restaurant was a little pricey but all meals were great. Anthony, the waiter was great. He served us the day we arrived and also the day we left. I would go back there for another vacation.
reviews.title: Fun Time for 5 days & 4 nights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is great. Everyone is friendly and it is a very clean hotel with nice amenities! It is an older hotel, but they've done a great job keeping it up. They should advertise that they do have a swim up pool bar because I almost stayed somewhere else that advertised it, but wanted an ocean front balcony so booked the Marriott. I was sooo happy to find out they had the swim up pool bar. The only problem I had was when I first went into the room it smelled musty and not sooo nice, but that's probably because the air conditioning was off. As soon as we turned it on, it cleared the smell, plus house keeping came and sprayed the room. All in all I would and have recommended staying here. It's a fabulous location, in the mix of everything!! The other plus is the Casino downstairs where I won money on the blackjack tables.
reviews.title: Great Time in PR as always!

reviews.text: The Marriott Stellaris was somewhat of a disappointment. The hotel was extremely cold especially in the lobby and casino area. I stayed on the 17th floor. I had an oceanview room which was a nice view but the room had a mold smell to it. Even when I got off the elevator to the floor the smell was there. There was some ants in my room near the balcony door which was a little bit irritating since the desk is right there by the door. The beds were ok but it would have been nice to have an extra blanket/cover since it was cold. Overall the staff was very nice. There are a few that I can tell are just there and could care less but that is everywhere. The location is great since Ashford Avenue has alot of options and is not far from Old San Juan. The casino was small but perfect for the hotel guests. The restaurants are expensive but that is to be expected. Overall, it is not a four star hotel. This hotel is old (as most of the ones in San Juan are) so if luxury is what you are looking for this is not the place. Overall, I think I will try another hotel in San Juan for my next visit. It just didn't overwhelm me for the price that they charge plus resort fees!
reviews.title: A little disappointing

reviews.text: The concierge very help with suggesting places for dinner. We end up at one of the suggestion. We really enjoyed it, the isla was great we love everyone there give us excellent service and they are very funny always making us laugh. We enjoyed the bartenders jeannett,manny jennifer waitress was very helpful bringing my wife coffee and they have excellent manager?General manager was so nice and polite making them feel very comfortable! please visit this place the employee there are dedicating to customers.
reviews.title: Excellent customer service!!!!!:-)))
Enjoyed The Stay...
reviews.text: We stayed here 3 nights for a work conference and prior to a cruise. The hotel itself was great, we had no problems with anything and the location was pretty central to our needs.

Room : we were lucky enough to get a corner room which felt very spacious. We had 2 sets of sliding doors and a small balcony. One side faced the beautiful waters and the other faced a building construction. Needless to say we kept the curtains closed on that side! The room was spacious with a king bed, a desk & chair, a lounge chair, flatscreen TV and a safe. The bathroom was great - it had all the amenities we needed.
reviews.title: Never Again!

reviews.text: Hotel : overall was very nice. The casino was a bit small but we only walked thru it, didn't play since we heard from others how tight the machines were. There is a bar right in the lobby so it's a nice place to people watch. It also has a small sundries store and concierge desk. We walked out to the pool which were very nice. Although there is a sign that says reserving chairs is only limited to half an hour, we never stayed long enough to see if it's enforced. The beach is okay. It can get crowded by noon so it's best to go out before that to get a chaise lounge and a good spot on the beach. The waves are pretty rough. While we were there, we saw a lot of locals body boarding and a lot of tourists getting knocked down by the waves (not badly though!). The workers there were very friendly. And everytime I called for housekeeping, they came right away to clean our room.
reviews.title: Some positives, some negatives

likes.liked: — Being able to walk out the front door and walk to shopping and restaurants

reviews.text: Restaurant : we only ate at one. It was the noodle bar tucked in the corner of the casino. We were craving noodles and it definitely hit the spot...although be expected to pay a lot more than at your usual local joint!
reviews.title: Absolutely LOVED the Marriott Stellaris!

likes.liked: — Newly renovated rooms with amazingly comfortable beds!
likes.disliked: — There wasn't anything I did not like

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location : is okay. If you're walking along the beach and look back, it may not look like "paradise" with a lot of run-down buildings and construction going on. But on the street, it seems better. There is a Starbucks right across the street (Haggen Daaz is coming soon!) and Walgreens right at the corner. If you're coming out of the hotel and turn left, there is a little strip mall area across the street. Try eat at the restaurant that sells gelato. I had a chicken sandwich there which was very good.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.text: We stayed here for three days, then went to the island of Vieques (highly recommend) and then came back for one night. Our first three nights were spectacular as we were given an executive suite in the cabana wing due to my husband's Marriott rewards status. The room was tastefully decorated, the bathroom huge, the balcony had a great view. We liked the beach, though it wasn't a kid friendly as I hoped. The pool was decent, but I liked the one at the Intercontinental better as we staryed there our last time in PR. We didn't like that the kids water slide was only upon until 4PM.
reviews.title: Decent hotel, a few glitches

likes.disliked: — front desk, double parking in the overpriced garage, high price of resort food

reviews.text: When we came to the hotel for our second stay we got a high ocean view room (1717) in the tower. The wrap around views were spectacular! That night however, the people in the room next to us decided to party all night, so we called security at 1AM and they came and quieted them down. We also called the front desk to ge the number of a local pizza joint we'd used earlier in the week and twice they gave us the number to the wrong restaurant, when we called the front deck the third time they didn't bother to pick up. The next morning we called for late check out and no one picked up the phone again. An hour later someone did pick up and part of our Marriott rewards benefit is "priority late checkout" where you pick the time and due to our late flight and having kids with us, we wanted to check out at 1PM. The desk said no one gets to check out past noon, only an hour later than normal, so this was an inconvenience.
reviews.title: Loved the Marriot. A great family experiencet

reviews.text: I'm a platinum member with Marriott and I was APPALLED by the condition of this hotel and the poor service we encountered. Check in took over an hour, the room was tiny and in disrepair, the staff would actually roll their eyes when we made simple requests, & the service was incredibly slow: we waited over an hour and a half for room service, and one day our room wasn't serviced until almost 5pm. The bed was very uncomfortable and the room was not clean. The balcanies are nice. The pool and beach are very nice but be warned, the pool, hot tub and beach have limited hours 8am-7pm and the staff tends to open late and close early. The slide is only open from 11-4, and the swim up bar is only open on the weekends. The club level smelled like a mixture of mold, rotten food and bug spray, it was nauseating. The mojitos in the lobby were great but be warned the drinks are pricey in the lobby and out at the poolside and beachside bars...average about $9 a piece. A nice service the hotel did offer, trip planners our vacation planner was great. As for the casino when we stopped in the place was full of locals that obviously make their careers gambeling and don't like outsiders, it was very uncomfortable. We managed to salvage our vacation in spite of the hotel; San Juan is a great place to visit! I would love to go back and I can assure you if we do, we won't be heading back to the Stellaris.
reviews.title: Be Warned
We loved the Marriott
reviews.text: We spent four days at the Marriott. Having read the reviews, we expected the resort fee and the high prices at the restaurants. It didn't stop us - the food was great, the service was terrific, and the property was incredible. We loved the beach and the convenient location. The cab ride, while a tad pricey, was worth EVERY penny! No traffic - no parking - no aggravation! We ate a yummy and well priced dinner at Angel's Cafe a couple of blocks west of the resort. I'm a Starbuck's fan and there's one right across the street - yay! The room had gorgeous city views and was spotlessly cleaned every day. This was our first time at a Marriott - it won't be our last. We will certainly return to the Stellaris Marriott! Thanks to everyone there for an enjoyable vacation!

reviews.title: Easy access to all
reviews.text: This is our 4th year at the Marriott in San Juan. Starbucks is just across the street. The Tuscany Rest in the Marriott is excellent. Try going to Santurce if you want great Spanish dinner and ambiance. The cab drive is only 10-15 min away. La Casona Rest is so beautiful that you cannot imagine why it is not advertised more. Golf courses - rent a car and go to Chichi Rodriguez' golf course in Guayama. $40 during the week cannot be beat and it has 19 holes. Chichi is there and it's great talking to him and his beautiful wife, very gracious. Caguas Golf course is closer but still under construction. If it's raining in San Juan, go to Guayama for golfing. The Marriott staff are always accomodating and can give you lots of advice. Old San Juan has great shopping. We go there regularly. Resort fee just started and you need to let them know when booking that you don't want it if you are not going to take advantage of the chairs and bottle of water. Oasis Massages are great.

reviews.title: THE BEST in San Juan
reviews.text: Really enjoyed it there!

I have stayed here counltess times over the past seven years and have never been disappointed. If you're looking for comfort but also local flavor, this is the place. Have stayed at the Ritz Carlton and it is wonderful, but with all the people from New Jersey and Long Island, I could have been in Florida or, well, anywhere. I like those people but I like loud, dancing, well dressed, fun Puerto Ricans also and you'll find them here dancing the night away in the lobby on weekends. It is a wonderul scene. Beautiful casino too. The beach is right there, not too far from the pool or your room and it is gorgeous. Again, it is not the Ritz Carlton, so don't rely on the concierge for much or expect pampering, but the staff is very friendly and nice. Rooms are comfortable, but, BEWARE, get one on a high floor or in the short building behind the pool to avoid hearing the music from the lobby. I've always requested a high floor and have had no trouble getting one. The food is very good for the buffet breakfast and lunch and also right there with the pool and beach. For dinner I like to go out..... it is San Juan and there are so many good restaurants. Go to the Marriott, have a great time.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nicely run hotel. Try for a room overlooking the ocean; I think it is a must. Very helpful staff on the beach. Rooms made up promptly. Our room surprisingly spacious. Make sure you know if the internet is free with your room--it is pricey if you have to pay. What I loved: some hotels ration towels by the pool/ocean, not here, take as many towels as you want! Only downside was lobby renovation, not noisy but some hotels down here have gorgeous lobbies, lobby here mostly boarded up til renovations complete.
reviews.title: Very pleasantly surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this resort for a long weekend, just my husband and I. We stayed on the concierge level and ate breakfast in that lounge everyday. It's worth it for what you will save on just breakfast alone. The views from the decks are incredible! We'd drink at the pool bar and ordered lunch once from there and ate on the beach. The drinks at the pool/beach bar can get expensive but it's a resort. We travel often so weren't surprised at the prices... Another reason we stayed in the club level, it winds up being a savings. We'd also go to the club level after the beach for a snack...to off set dinner.
reviews.title: Great Beach...just for sunning!

reviews.text: We ate in the italian restaurant located in the hotel one night, not many people around, the food was good and we had a bottle of wine, which was priced well.
reviews.title: Pure relaxation!

reviews.text: One night we ate at Morton's (caribe hilton) which yes, we have back in Baltimore... but it was wonderful and the grounds of the Hilton looked amazing.
reviews.title: Construction but nice casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The casino here was full each night, we aren't big gamblers.. I went in, played until $20 was lost and then we left. The lobby bar is iffy, not many people there and the service was so-so. Only 1 of the 4 nights there did we stay for any length of time ( more then 30 mins) because we'd met a nice man traveling for work and sat with him.
reviews.title: Beautiful/Clean/Friendly and Helpful Staff
My Fabulous Vacation
reviews.text: I had heard mixed reviews about the resort. We had a fantastic time, it was our first family vacation and our first time in the Caribbean. The hotel and staff were fantastic. We were always greeted with a smile. Other guests were just as friendly, chatting with others on the beach, in the pool & hot tub, even the elevator. The security made me feel safe with my son & niece running around. Its a great location, the beach is amazing. La Vista Restaurant on site is a great family restaurant and they have themed buffets each night. Tuscany was also great, but with kids the wait for our food was too long. There is a Walgreens, Wendy's & a Subway down the street for those trying to stick to a budget for meals also . The concierge set us up for the El Yunque rainforest tour. If you can swing it, it was fabulous, the tour guide was as entertaining as the tour itself. We can't wait to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriot San Juan Resort and Stellaris Casino for 5 days, and we really had a great experience there!
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OVERALL: The room was a good size and it was worth every penny to pay a little extra for the pool/ocean view... it was great to sit out on the balcony with a cold drink and look out at the pool area and (beyond the pool area) the gorgeous clear blue ocean! The room stayed kind of damp/humid all week, but I think some of that may be inevitable given the Caribbean climate! The location was good too. Nice beach, especially if you like playing in the waves (not super calm water, but that was a good thing for us!).
reviews.title: OK but not worth the premium

reviews.text: Money-Saving Tip for Drinkers: The drinks at the pool area were definitely overpriced, so we decided to buy our own little bottle of rum and some juice, etc mixers at one of the many little grocery/liquer stores within walking distance. (For about $20 worth of "stocking the bar" in our room, we were able to get the amount of drinks that would have cost $200 at the bar over the course of the week!).
reviews.title: Good Experience at the Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are interested in touring the Bacardi Rum factory, don't book your trip through the tour company in the hotel.... they will likely charge you around $50 per person, and in reality you can get there and have that entire experience for less than $30 total. Overall this was a good afternoon, but we were so glad we hadn't spent $100 to have the tour company take us there! We did book a trip to hike in El Yunque through the tour desk at the hotel, and that turned out to be a very good choice! We never would have been able to pick out the most scenic spot to go hiking had we chosen to rent a car, drive there ourselves, etc... plus it was nice to not have to worry about transportation (it's about 45 mins away).
reviews.title: Marriot San Juan was perfect!

reviews.text: This is a nice hotel with a very good location. The staff was nice, and the bar near the beach has a happy hour. The beach was pretty good, but it is public -- and the hotel can only keep it so-so clean.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, watch your bill

reviews.text: The best part of the hotel is the location. There are several nice places to eat within walking distance (Yerba Buena, Ropa Vieja, Ajili Mojili to name a few). Meals at the hotel were strictly expense accout. There is a Starbucks and Walgreens nearby as well which proved handy.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: The downsides of this hotel for me were the cab ride to Old San Juan which was $10-15 bucks each way which I thought was a lot. There is a public bus which I saw frequently except when I tried to take it. Another thing that dissapointed me was that the hotel pool was only 4 ft deep - and we weren't traveling with kids.
reviews.title: Accomodating staff, beautiful beach, great room!

reviews.text: One other thing to be aware of is that the hotel charges a resort fee of $13 per day, which was a lot for us because we spent very little time at the resort. We purchased our trip through Orbitz, and had no idea of the fee until check out. Had we known, we may have stayed elsewhere. Kind of cheesy.
reviews.title: Good value - we wouldn't hesitate to return to the Marriott

reviews.text: We stayed from last Sat-Wed and had a great time. Checked in in about 5 mins, got a nice 9th floor ocean/pool room with balcony. This is definitely one of the nicer resorts to stay at. The room was big and comfy. You get 1 free hour of internet at the business center; there is also free wifi at the cafe across the street and at Starbucks (not free). The gym downstairs is great (after 10p you can't use the lockerroom/sauna). Minor complaints: when I tried to shower at 3am there was no hot water; the swim-up bar was closed; no food/drink service at the pool (you have to get it yourself). as stated by several others, the prices in the hotel are high (iced coffee is $3.50). better to go to starbucks. The best meal of the trip was at Zabo (also the most expensive). All the other places were just "ok": Yerba Buena (bad mojitos), Waikiki (nice ambiance). The safe in the room was very welcome, though we felt very safe the entire time. The casino was fun and we didn't have any problem finding space at the $5 blackjack tables.
reviews.title: Past it's prime

reviews.text: Just came back from an all girls trip to Puerto Rico. We originally booked the Caribe Hilton with the expectations of a nice hotel. The lobby was beautiful but after seeing the room we quickly exited stage left. Definitely not worth the money!!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

likes.disliked: — location to old san juan and parking fees

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So we headed over to the Marriott. It was beautiful. The lobby was nice. The bell men were cute and the rooms were clean and nicely decorated. Our first room had some leakage problems and we were promptly relocated (with help) and given a $100 credit.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: We didn’t eat at the hotel at all, too pricey for us. There is a great restaurant down the street with really good Puerto Rican food that is open 24 hours. I can’t remember the name of it but it is right next to Walgreen’s on the Ashford Ave. side. The portions are large so we either shared or took the leftovers back to the hotel. We inquired about a microwave and a few minutes later a guy was knocking on the door with a microwave to put in the room, free of charge!!
reviews.title: Poor Hospitality in San Juan Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino
Loved the beach behind it
reviews.text: After realizing all the taxi rides were going to cost a small fortune, we chose the bus. Only $.75 each way! The bus goes everywhere from Old San Juan to Isle Verde and even the airport.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Old San Juan is nice and perfect for tourists. We found a little shack by the port that served the best Marlin pastelillos, the manager, Andres is really nice. We also caught the ferry over to the Bacardi plant for free drinks!!! The souvenir shops definitely weren’t as cheap as the Bahamas. The clubs were okay. Too many young people though. Senior Frogs has a great atmosphere but leaves something to be desired in the food department.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

likes.disliked: — pool area could be a little larger

reviews.text: We stayed here one night with our daughter enroute back to the States after spending a week on Culebra. This property was really nice - rooms, pool, gym (ok, not great) and the location was good. It's in the Condado area so it was easy to walk and grab dinner. However, I was amazed at all of the college kids on spring break staying at this property. We paid well over $300 a night - when I was in college, that certainly wasn't in budget. Anyway, we could hear the kids in the room next to us with their dance music blasting. We called the concierge to complain and reached a recording, left a message, but they never returned our call.
reviews.title: Nice Property, but too many spring breakers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The other thing we found a little absurd was that they charged $25 a night for a infant crib. Maybe this is standard, but I haven't seen this before.
reviews.title: Great Little Getaway

likes.liked: — Entertainment in the hotel and nearby restaurants

reviews.title: Just ok but clean ....
reviews.text: I'm not sure that I would stay there again, I might opt for the La Concha property just down the road.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I truly enjoyed my little Birthday getaway. We really found the reviews on here to be on point. The hotel was decent we got a different room with a better view. You may need to know a little spanish to communicate with the maid and some waiters at the nearby restaurants and stores. The live band downstairs was a treat. The food is ridiculously high. Breakfast was like $15 dollars with no meat. So we went to the 24 hour Latin Cafe and it was very reasonable. Restaurants were decent nearby. The cab driver recommended Ajili Mojili which was awesome. Best tres leche cake ever. They had a veal dish that I never thought I would like sweet. Took a bus almost right outside the hotel. They don't seem to be as regular as we hoped. Got free drinks at the Bacardi Rum Distillery. I don't even drink much but enjoyed the ferry ride to get there from Old San Juan. We are definitely going back. Almost forgot to mention passion fruit juice is a regular thing I think the drinks they gave us while we waited to check in were delicioso. Rum punch or something.
reviews.title: We made the right choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First - we booked through priceline for a Saturday night after a cruise for $175 per night ..... when we checked in asked to see if an upgrade was available - offered $25 extra per night for ocean/pool view room - so we upgraded. ........ we checked in at 11:00 - GREAT service there!!!! .......... room had a good view - we were in the tower building - would highly recommend requesting that section......... Room was nice, clean, AC worked GREAT! .... nice balcony area, also flat screen tv. Pool area was just ok, hard to find a place to sun due to all the palm trees ...... beach area also just ok - nobody came around taking drink or food orders, had to track people down to try to take $$ from us for these things :) ........ casino - small, but ok - not great selection of slots, etc ....... $10 taxi ride to Old San Juan - $15.50 taxi ride to airport ....... clean, decent place to stay after cruise - last time we stayed at the Ritz - 10 times better, but of course you pay the $$ too.......... we also ate dinner at the buffet restaurant - yucky!! don't recommend............. starbucks and ice cream shop right across the street ........ they do not have scales to weigh your luggage in the hotel, so be aware of that if traveling after a cruise where you've bought lots of things - we just had to guess on the weight of our bags :)
reviews.title: I hate germs and bad service.... Neither was a issue...
not good
reviews.text: we stayed two nights at the Marriott,it was not good. When we arrived on Sunday night the lobby was outragiously loud and mobbed. Many people were waiting for thier rooms, and complaining. Our room was ready and we checked in quickly. The room was in need of an overhaul. the bathroom had drops of water falling from where i couldn't tell. The pool was smaller than pictured and crowded. Half of the pool is a baby pool and the other half was taken up with a volley ball game. Not inviting. the beach is ok but not enough shade.

reviews.title: average hotel
reviews.text: I would not recommend. /we moved on to the Ritz Carlton and it was terrific, and cheaper rates. The food is better and more reasonable at the marriott.

reviews.title: Great island for a long weekend
reviews.text: stayed from 6/19-6/28 room was humid and never cool enough for my taste. staff was very fast and nice about finding us another room but both rooms they suggested were either just as hot or with a crummier view. hotel food was expensive and there are plenty of restaurants close by that are good and cheaper. Dannys, a block to your left as you leave the hotel has a great breakfast, Buno Ayres restaurant was not worth the money. Tony Romas Ribs is a good walk but good. Walgreens, a block to your right as you exit has everything. Hotel pool was small, the beach was good, very windy at times. Loquillo Beach was like a salt water pool. El Yunque was great, take the La Mina trail. Old San Juan had all the shopping, not much near the hotel. Hotel was convenient to many things though. Lobby was almost always entertaining, with bands and dancing but there were signs that you could not sit at the tables after 4pm unless you had a 2 drink minimum (at $7 each)

reviews.title: Worst then terrible!!!!
reviews.text: Memorial Day weekend 2004: There was a convention of those w.an alternative lifestyle so 4 months of dieting and not even one glance! Staff was always polite and responsive. It's off the strip. Beach is great and pool is relaxing. Food was a bit expensive but what can you expect. If you want an "it" place to stay, check out the El San Juan on the strip. Marble everywhere, dark wood, a little ritzier.

reviews.title: A family hotel not for a romantic retreat
reviews.text: If you want to be treated bad, VERY BAD!! Then you may like it here. I have to say. I was one of 38 people that flew over from the stated fo a wedding. Several people stayed at at the Marriotts in Isle Verde and Condodo, I am telling you about the Condodo location, I stayed in Puerto Rico for 10 days and the Marriott ruined one night of that for myself and others, I had a bad experience in the casino with manager on April 27, 2004. This is a ruff version. You see when 5 of us walked up to the lobby bar to order drinks, they sent us to the casino to get service, So we did, We then waited at that casino bar to get service. Guess What ??No service. The manager told us if we wanted to get service then we would have to play slots.OK!! So we did. 45min. passed NO Service, I asked the manager why we couldn't get some drinks. You'll love this. The manager told me that we were play the wrong slot to get service, Then he walked away. I went to the front desk to put a complaint in with the manager of the hotel, but he never showed. I told the girl at the front desk I will be writting Tripadvisor with a poor score for this hotel. So 3 of us left the hotel to go back to ours (THE WINDCHIMES GREAT!!!!) The 2 that were left behind were still playing in the casino$$$ and when they went back to there room they were met by security and they were told because I!!!! was reporting them to Tripadvisor they would have to leave. They then called the bride and groom woke them up to see if they could stay with them I guess everything work it's self out by 3:00am. But I cant tell you how unprofessional, the Marriott's staff was and is. Then Puerto Ricans DEPEND!!!on the $$$$$ from the people who come to there Island, and I can tell 38 people bring in a whole lot of money for them. So I guess the I can tell you I WILL NEVER! EVER! stay at a Marriott !! Even though I did not stay here, I should have been treated as a in house guest would have, with respect and kindness and no less. So if you stay here and have a bad experience , I told you so!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our trip to San Juan Puerto Rico, was so amazing. The wife and I had some we time away from the kids and truey enjoyed our stay at the Marrioutt Stellaris Casino Resort. The customer service was excellent and the people were so friendly. We were the in June during the San Juan Food Festival and it was a great. Good food, music and the weather was perfect. We will be back and this time we will bring the kids they will have a ball.
reviews.title: San Juan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Marriott Stellaris in Condado for 6 days and we had a very nice time. The staff at the hotel is very friendly and helpful without being too much or all over you. They really respect your space and are very accomodating. We had the breakfast buffet included in our package and the dinner buffet one night and it was good. The service was excellent. When I inspected the other hotels in the area that we were considering, I'm glad we chose the Marriott.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay in Condado

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Marriott this week from 8/17-8/21. Nice hotel on the beach. Everyone is friendly. The beach us amazing and there are complimentary beach chairs and umbrella for hotel guest. The hotel pool has a slide one kiddy pool, one adult pool with walk up bar and a jacuzzi. I did not eat in the hotel as there are so many great restaurant around the hotel such as pinky's for breakfast( the best smoothies and mallorca sandwich!)Alibaba ( Turkish rest) for lunch on the weekend/ dinner( we went there during lunch which they only open for the weekend). They are amazing!, Tascal El Pescador for the most amazing seafood (15 mins walk), Starbucks in front of the hotel, Walgreen nearby. The list can go on and on. There are no water sports activities on the beach though. So if you are looking for a nice beach hotel within walking distance to restaurant and nightlife. Safe to walk around the area ( police are everywhere) . This is the hotel for you. If you look for water sports activities you might want to consider staying at Isla verde. By the way, make a trip to El Jibarito in old San Juan for local puerto rican food. Our best meal in San Juan!
reviews.title: Nice beach front hotel and walking distance to nice restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The concierge recommended us to go to cafe Lola. Expensive and the food is not as impressive as El Jibarito.
reviews.title: Excellent Anniversary Trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently celebrated my anniversary trip Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casino and we were overly impressed with our stay. The location is perfectly situated in Condado, with the beach directly behind the hotel so no major walking is necessary. There is a 24-hour Walgreens a block away from the hotel which we found to be very useful and visited practically every day. The rooms are small but we had no problems or complaints with it. We initially reserved a city-view room but upgraded to a pool-side view (for $25/night) which was perfect since the beach was directly to the right of the pool. An ocean-view room will run you $50/night. The casino is quite small compared to other casino resort hotels in Condado if you're into that sort. Check-in and concierge services were pleasant experiences and did not give me a hard time or any hassle. The pool and jacuzzi were open until 11pm so we took advantage of nightly swims to avoid the morning and afternoon crowds.
reviews.title: A wonderful stay!!
Mother and daughter experiencing our roots
reviews.text: Our stay was at the Marriott Stellaris in the Condado in San Juan. My daughter and I had never been to Puerto Rico for pleasure. We are of Puerto Rican decent but only visited when someone in the family passed away. Well I must say that the boogey man that everyone seem to warn us about never gave us a problem. My daughter is 19 yrs and let me tell she had her share of telephone numbers. But we felt safe at all times. We went out at all times of the day and never once felt the we could be in danger. Everyone was polite, pleasant and very helpful in the hotel and out about town.

reviews.title: Not the greatest
reviews.text: We took a taxi to old San Juan and saw sooo many gorgeous sites that we can't wait to see again. The food was excellent except in some places you have to wait a while for it. We also rented a car and we recommed it highly to travel the Island. We drove all the way to Arecibo, and experience the beautiful beaches..

reviews.title: Marriott San Juan, Not great but still pretty good
reviews.text: The hotel was awesome there was live music every night with quite a crowd for dancing. and security to the hotel was wonderful.
So for two women traveling for the first time alone it was a wonderful experience our spanish is ok... but everyone spoke English or spanglish so it worked out perfect...
reviews.title: Great Experience-I was very happy and would go back.

reviews.text: My family of 4 just got back from staying at the San Juan Marriott. We were not entirely pleased with the hotel. The staff was excellent and very helpful. Out of the 2 restaurants the Tuscany was very good. La Vista had a buffet breakfast, lunch and dinner. If you are into buffets this is the way to go. The kids loved it but a waste of money. I dont care for buffets and I thought the menu was very boring...all I wanted was a toss salad and couldnt get one! The pool area was very nice, however, get your chairs early because they go fast and by 11am there is none to be found. The pool swim-up bar was closed, no activites for the kids, they had a volley ball net, but no balls and by the middle of the week the net was gone. The 90 ft slide was the best feature, you have to try it, I even did, it was great! However, they open up a 11am close by 4, while alot of the families are just getting back from day trips by that time, a real bummer for my kids. The beach area was very clean and nice, the water is a little rough(undertoe) but that depends if the wind is blowing or not. The lounge area at nite was very quite, on the weekends the locals come and dance, the place was mobbed. The casino was good, didnt hit on the slots but played 21/2 hours at roulette table with $25, I should have walked away when I was well ahead! Overall, it was just OK, I would not stay there again. Restaurants...Miros...2blocks down(walking distance) was excellent, service was great.The Cherry Blossom next door is your typical bonzai restaurant, good for the kids. We went to the Caribe Hilton to Mortons, great steak, but expensive. This hotel looked great, we took a walk around, tons of stuff for the kids. We rented a car and went to Liguillo beach by Farajedo, about an hr. drive from San Juan, absolutely beautiful, plan on doing a day there. Seven Seas beach was nothing to brag about. We did East Coast Cattermaran/snorkel great time, the crew was great, they made 2 stops to snorkel, one shallow water which was great for my 7 year old, they have aslide off the back of the boat. They gave us a great lunch and all we could drink. The 2nd stop was in deeper waters, the water current was too stong for me and my 7 yr old. All in all, great experience. We did the new/old San Juan bus tour/ one of the forts, nice trip, the kids were bored until we got to the fort, only 45 minutes to shop, was not enough time. I would suggest to do a 1/2 day in old San Juan or more. Dont go on Sunday evening, the shops close by 5 or 6. All in all the trip was great, next time I would definately not stay in San Juan. OBTW...the Intercontinental, ESL, Hilton looked great.
reviews.title: Needs a lot of updates but great location
Great Hotel for Our Quick Stopover
reviews.text: Our family of four spent last Saturday night at the Marriott Stellaris and were not disappointed. We used Marriott points to stay for free and were given an oceanview (from the side) room instead of the city view we were supposed to get. The hotel was seven minutes and $17.50 from the airport and we were able to check in at 1 p.m. on a very busy day for them (cruise ship turnover day during Northeast schools' vacation week). Check in took only five minutes.
The room was just like most Marriotts. Could use newer carpet but the rest was fine. Bathroom was updated but only had one sink (but a big vanity). Nice balcony with a view.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: The resort bustles with activity which we enjoyed for one night (it's not the type of place we would want to spend our vacation but that's just our preference). Pool area was crowded but fun--loved having live music with a Latin flair, poolside lunch service was quick, expensive and server was very friendly. Tough finding chaise lounges but that was to be expected. Kids enjoyed the pool slide and swimming in the ocean--great waves!
reviews.title: Loved Puerto Rico and Marriott Resort

reviews.text: Wish we'd had another night to enjoy the hotel and Old San Juan. Was surprised how much I enjoyed all of it after a lazy week on St. Croix. Would definitely go back to the Marriott and San Juan.
reviews.title: Nice get-away

reviews.text: One note: be sure to give yourself PLENTY of time to check into the airport--all lines are long!--thank goodness we get to speed through them due to husband's gold status on American. Should have arrived at least 1 1/2 hours early.
reviews.title: Had a Great Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just finished our stay in San Juan. I am 36, and this was my first real luxury hotel beach vacation experience. I will say it was very relaxing. The hotel upgraded us to a corner room with windows facing two sides for $50 + tax/night. We had a large private balcony overlooking the ocean. Very nice. The pool area, location (close to many good restaurants, bars, and other hotels/casinos), and staff were excellent. The beach here is kind of rough and not as pretty as some other places on the island.
reviews.title: Great location. Very good hotel. O.K. beach.

reviews.text: The hotel set us up on day trips to El Yunque and snorkelling. Both were excellent. The drinks at the bars were excellent and fairly priced given a hotel setting. The room service breakfast was overpriced and underwhelming though. Recommend walking across the street to Starbucks or Camille's sidewalk cafe for quality light fair at a reasonable price.
reviews.title: Worth every penny

reviews.text: My wife and I enjoy walking through hotels and looking at their facilities. We walked in every hotel on Condado, and concluded that if we return to Condado, this is the hotel. However, we are favoring Isle Verde next trip (maybe the Hotel Intercontinental) because of the better beach.
reviews.title: Loved it! Would stay again!!!

reviews.text: Loved having the pool and the beach at the same hotel. Although the food, like in any hotel, is pricey - the location and staff were wonderful. Concierge staff were very helpful. The rooms were very nice and beds pretty comfortable. The cleanliness was very much appreciated and I loved seeing the staff clean around the clock regardless of what time I was walking around and where I was walking around the hotel. My favorite highlight of the day was waking up before the whole family and taking my book to the lobby, ordering a cafe con leche (=coffee with milk, which was not on the menu but made friends with the girls at the coffee stand and they made it on request).
reviews.title: Puerto Rico much nicer than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the best time. The employees were friendly. The place was clean and had a ton to offer. It rained the week we were there, but had a blast. There was a misunderstanding at check in, but I called after our trip and the Marriott made good on it.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, great location ,and pleasant staff - though can get expensive quickly if you’re not careful

reviews.text: Service was great overall. The guest services personnel were accomodating and nice. Valet always came quickly. I've stayed at other 4 and 5 star resorts where waited for valet for 15 minutes to an hour and that was with a call requesting the car before we came down.
reviews.title: Tropical Paradise

likes.liked: — The pools, the beach, the staff, the room, the view, the location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The casino was fine. Obviously small by most standards but they had a little bit of everything. Slots of all ranges (1 cent to $1 or more), blackjack tables, craps, roulette etc.
reviews.title: Perfect in every way

reviews.text: The salsa dancing in the lobby at night was unbelievably loud, but once you walk away from that area, it was bearable.
reviews.title: Be Carefull when you make your reservation!

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel pre and post cruising. The resort itself is very clean and have friendly employees. The rooms are also very clean. The restaurants were a little expensive but there are a lot of local places nearby that were great and less expensive.
reviews.title: marriott stellaris san juan

reviews.text: So, we were disputing between this hotel, the Ritz and the El San Juan. We ultimately picked the Marriott because we got an ocean front balcony for the same price as a city or pool view at either of the other hotels.
reviews.title: Honeymoon hotel after our cruise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Marriott is a solid 4 and I'll break it down for you. We're in our 20's and we were definitely missing some more evening activities/clubs/etc. within the hotel. The casino felt very separated from the hotel and was 95% slots and a few table games. 2 blackjack tables, 1 roulette, 1 craps, and maybe 2 poker tables.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, the lobby was under construction and they said it would be opened around 11/18/11... I'm not in construction, but that seemed ambitious. The hotel could very well get a five star rating once the lobby is done because right now there is huge void in the hotel.
reviews.title: What an awesome view

reviews.text: Cleanliness was spot on... No pun intended. Very clean, I didn't feel grossed out at any point and the room servicing was quick and consistent. The bathrooms are typical for any commercial hotel and have a few spots of concern, but I'm not overly sensitive to those things.
reviews.title: My iCelebrate Birthday San Juan Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino X-Perience!

reviews.text: The San Juan Marriott is a beautiful resort hotel in the Condado section of San Juan. It has a stunning bi-level pool and direct access to a broad public beach. Our room was large, clean, and comfortable, and had a widescreen LCD TV -- as well as a wonderful broad shower head with dozens of tiny holes for a wide spread . We had a full view of the pool area and a partial view of the ocean. The hotel staff were all extremely courteous and helpful, and we kept them hopping with many requests, such as for additional towels and glasses.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Resort Hotel

reviews.text: There were 2 minor problems with the room: a burned-out light bulb in one of the lamps -- replaced within 5 minutes after we called to complain -- and a noisy air conditioner vent. We considered moving to another room, but by the second day we were used to the noise and didn't notice it anymore.
reviews.title: great stay

reviews.text: The hotel has 2 restaurants: La Vista, a casual cafe; and Tuscany, a high-end Italian restaurant. There are several excellent restaurants within an easy walk of the Marriott, and numerous dining choices in OSJ. Food in San Juan tends to be expensive, but it's almost always cheaper to dine outside of the hotel. For a quick, inexpensive breakfast, there's a coffee bar in the hotel lobby, and a Starbucks directly across the street.
reviews.title: "Our Second Stay in Less Than a Year, An Absolutely Fabulous Hotel"

reviews.text: The bus to Old San Juan stops at the end of the block that the Marriott is on, and takes about 20 minutes to reach Old SJ. The usual bus fare is 75 cents, but all buses were free when we were there. Buses stop running at 10 PM, and a taxi back from OSJ to the Marriott costs about $15.
reviews.title: Relaxing weekend at the Stellaris

reviews.text: All in all, I would recommend the SJ Marriott - Stellaris to anyone.
reviews.title: Wonderful Family Trip

reviews.text: I rated this "above average" hotel a rating of "EXCELLENT" on the overall experience. My husband and I, along with several of our friends had a wonderful stay in San Juan. While I went to great extents to research exactly where we would stay, I had my fingers crossed and I prayed that my selection was a good one. I was pleasantly surpised to see that most of the reviews I had read on Trip Advisor were accurate. The renovated corner rooms in the tower section of the hotel are absolutely beautiful. You have two balconies, once which is ocean front and the other is either ocean or pool view. Beware of the cabana rooms as most of those are not renovated and the difference between the two (renovated and non-renovated) are like staying at the Waldorf Astoria versus Motel 6. Great pool...you even get some "eye candy" (pool boys) passing around fruit while you take in some rays. Excellent beach front property overall.
reviews.title: Absolutely loved the San Juan Marriott!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel, in Condado, is ideal; close to high-end shopping (Gucci, Louis Vuitton, Cartier to name a few) are walking distance. There are also a few non-national brand boutiques that have a great selection of fashion. There is no need for a rental car, taxis are readily accesible.
reviews.title: One Great Vacation

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, hotel extremely clean (in and out)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
