reviews.text: Old San Juan is great and is only a 12-15 minute drive from the hotel. A lot of national brand shopping mixed with other quaint boutiques. Plan to spend a day or two in Old San Juan to get everything in.
reviews.title: Wonderful Time

likes.disliked: — Room was not ready at check in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: El Yunque (the rainforest) is also a MUST. The drive is long, so booking through the hotel is a safe way to go - $64 (includes transportation and tour of the forest).
reviews.title: Much better than most reviews. . .

likes.disliked: — It was overrun by families, not very conducive to young singles until late night

reviews.text: The Barcardi tour, in my opinion, was very boring. The taxi ride from the hotel was $35 plus $5 for each additional person, $36 wait time (if you want the taxi to wait while you take the 1 hour tour) and the same price for your return. Needless to say, you are paying for the "free" tour in the taxi fare. However, the two free drinks and the Barcardi store are a nice compliment to the otherwise boring experience.
reviews.title: The best place to stay in Condado

likes.liked: — The view of the city/ocean and the remoldeling of the rooms
likes.disliked: — Housekeping could have been alittle better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby area of the hotel is very nice. They have live music and dancing in the evening. The casino is nice, but totally non-smoking. For most this is a plus, but for someone who smokes and goes to casinos regularly it was a bummer.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but front desk needs help

likes.liked: — It was right on the beach
likes.disliked: — The front desk help was very slow. And the scenery around the beach was terrible

reviews.text: The check in process took forever. We waited almost 30 minutes for someone to helps us. Then we had to wait until 430p for a room. They did hold our bags for us.
reviews.title: Great Resort

likes.liked: — overall just a great place to be with a happy staff
likes.disliked: — slow service during brunch and lunch

reviews.text: The room was very clean and the amenities were up to date. For the amount of money you pay for a night I don't think it was worth it. However, in the Conado area is the best.
reviews.title: What a view!

reviews.text: The beach was nice and clean. They had chairs and umbrellas for guest. The good thing is they aren't set up already. You have to ask one of the workers for one and they set everything up for you. No chair saving or fighting over the loungers. There was plenty for everyone.
reviews.title: Lovely resort, lots to do nearby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant twice. It was good, but not great. However, the prices are ridiculous. The lunch buffet was $19.00 a person.
reviews.title: Not bad at all.

reviews.text: I booked this trip 4 months in advance after reading reviews. I originally wanted to stay at the InterContinental but couldn't find a great rate and like the location of the Marriott better. We got a rate of $179/night because the reservations center made an error. That in itself was a hassle. But onto the vacation...
reviews.title: Great Vacation - But Not Fabulous

reviews.text: I was meeting a friend there from Boston and she arrived first, checking into a smoking, ocean-front room. The only reason we stayed was because it DID NOT smell like smoke - we are both non-smokers but loved the view. Unfortunately, the hotel said they did not have any other ocean front rooms available in non-smoking so we would have been stuck in city-view if it had smelled.
reviews.title: Nice on the inside, but looks a little shabby outside
20th Anniversary Vacation
reviews.text: We had a housekeeping issue the first night as well, finding hair in the bed and in the shower that was not ours, and immediately called the front desk. The hotel did show great customer service in giving us a $100 credit at the Italian restaurant on site. (More on that later) But at check-out, it showed a small charge from the restaurant that we had been told had been covered...was resolved, but an added hassle. Other than the hair, the room was fine, the beds were comfortable and it was clean.

reviews.title: Spotlessly clean, friendly staff, great pool
reviews.text: Tuscany, the italian restaurant, is AMAZING. Not only is the service fabulous, but the food is wonderful. We had pasta with lobster, ossa bucco, grilled salmon, seared tuna and loved our meals....Definitely go there if you are in town whether you stay at the restaurant or not.

reviews.title: #3 in San Juan is questionable
reviews.text: The rest of the trip was fine...the pool was crowded as it was a holiday weekend and there were lots of kids but that didn't bother us. The only issue at the pool is finding a sunny place to be for the day. The hotel placed palm trees all over the pool area and they block the sun depending on where you sit. The beach is all open and they have lounge chairs and umbrellas although if you like long walks on the beach, this is not the place for you. I enjoy walking the beach to exercise and there's not too far to walk. There is a great band at night in the lobby and a casino in the hotel(a few $5 and $10 tables for blackjack). Plus you can walk to a bunch of restaurants and bars on Ashford Ave.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & i wanted an easy getaway without our 2 boys & we got it! The hotel was great. The location is so convenient to everything-there are plenty of great restaurants within walking distance-the pool & the beach were both terrific. Service was excellent(especially Sonny who is a waiter in the restaurant(I think its called La Casita)-after ordering breakfast our 1st morning-he remembered both of our drink orders(iced tea & iced coffee with 1/2 & 1/2)-they arrived without even placing an order.
reviews.title: Great Getaway-convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds were also very comfortable. we had free wifi too. We got great tv channels for that time between sunning & going out for dinner & at night when we would come back to the room. Only slight issue--bar drinks were very expensive($10 pina coladas, mojitos etc) Would go back in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Absolutely No Complaints!

reviews.text: We were there for 5 nights on our honeymoon. I was very satisfied with the hotel. It was always clean and I loved that there was someone to assist w/our bags at check in and check out. Very friendly staff, they made me feel like a VIP!
reviews.title: A solid hotel.

reviews.text: My only frustration was that there was no free Internet service in the room, only in the lobby.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The location, value and overall experience at the hotel will definitely have me booking at this property on my next visit to San Juan. The beach location is great and the customer service was wonderful. As a tip, the Walgreens down the block will sell you a case of beer for 10 bucks while the hotel charges you 6 bucks a glass. It's the same beer and you can take your beer right to the beach.
reviews.title: Girls Trip to Puerto Rico!

reviews.text: Excellent hotel! Rooms well appointed, spacious and clean. Dining options very good. You have to try The Tuscany. Resort facilities: pools, beachfront excellent and well maintained. Lastly the location of the hotel itself is outstanding as it is close to many non hotel dining and drinking options if that's your thing. There's numerous walkable restaurants and shops offering an excellent variety of dining choices.
reviews.title: Now this is a resort!

reviews.text: You really can't go wrong with this hotel compared to the nearby competition.
reviews.title: Pretty good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice beach,clean. Lots of surf at beach,so can be rough. Pool area great. The restaurants are overpriced but ok. The family activities shown on website aren't really available. Beautiful views.
reviews.title: Nice time but the lobby was under construction :-(

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went for a long weekend recently and had a very nice stay. The room was clean and not cramped. The bathroom is spacious and updated. The TV reception is poor but we shouldn't be watching tv anyway! The pool area is nice but awkwardly arranged. The beach was clean and the second you step down off of the patio they run to set you up with chairs/umbrellas. (Ricardo also asked if we were coming the next day and he would have us set up prior to our arrival...towels too). The pool/beach food and drinks were a little pricey but tasty! The casino is average. Plenty of shops/restaurants in walking distance. We didn't take advantage of the spa. There is also an ocean-side bar/restaurant area that offers the same food as the pool/beach. We had breakfast at LaVista and highly recommend the buffet. We did not eat at Tuscany. Only a 10 min $20 cab ride to Old San Juan. CON: The lobby was under construction which greatly reduces the amount of common space for the hotel. It leaves 1 lounging area & a very small bar/coffee service area on the lobby level. Which makes it difficult to hang out or meet up before heading out. Still a very nice place in a centrally located area.
reviews.title: Great long week-end getaway

reviews.text: We did not have any complaints about the hotel. We booked a package that included breakfast and it was a nice buffet. I had requested early arrival and our room was ready about 1 1/2 hrs before the check-in time and we got a phone call while we were sunning ourselves on the beach (you can change in the spa and check your bags with the bellman). They also gave us a later check out than the 11 AM which worked great for us.
reviews.title: Very Good Location and Price

reviews.text: My best friend and I went to San Juan in April. The Marriot is an okay hotel. It looks alot better in the pictures. It is not a luxuary hotel. There is a wing that has recently been renovated, we did not stay in that wing. Our room was a little above the quality of a Motel 6. However, we heard that the side that had been renovated was nice. The beach was beautiful and made the stay worth it. We stayed on the Marriot beach for one day and then we went to other beaches. YOU MUST GO TO CULEBRA ISLAND. Culebra Island was one of the most beautiful beaches I have ever seen in my life. The ferry to go over is $2.50. When you get off the ferry, take the bus to flamingo beach (2.00). YOU HAVE TO TAKE THIS TRIP. Anyway, the Marriot is okay. There is a nightclub across the street that was popular and plenty of walking distance to many resturants. Pureto Rico is a great island to visit, but you are cheating yourself, if you only stay in San Juan. By the way, almost everyone speaks or understands English, so do not make a fool of yourself, by trying to speak the spanish you learned in high school or college. Dining at the Marriot was NOT impressive.
reviews.title: Must Read if going to San Juan

reviews.text: Make sure you tell Juan and Edwardo, Monica from Philadelphia said Hi and that I am going to open a can of whip ---!
reviews.title: Coonstruction! - Travel Agent's review

reviews.text: I am pretty amazed after reading the positive reviews on this website and visiting the Marriott firsthand. Did no one see what we saw? I must say that I will never book anyone in the Marriott, San Juan especially but probably not the Condado area as well. Here's why.
reviews.title: Marriott has changed a lot since the last time I went there..
Girls Just Wanna Have Fun
reviews.text: First off, be forewarned that construction in the San Juan area (including Old San Juan and Candado) is rampant and EVERYWHERE - as are the problems that come along with it in any city, namely; traffic, noise, congestion. If this statement alone is enough to make you question San Juan as a place you'd like to vacation peacefully - trust your instincts and book a hotel at an alternate location in PR outside of the San Juan city area (Dorado, Isla Verde or farther) or choose an alternate island in the carribbean.

reviews.title: Highly Recommend San Juan Marriott
reviews.text: As for the Marriott itself, and I am AMAZED no one has really made a point of this, THE HOTEL ITSELF IS UNDERGOING A 4 PHASE RECONSTRUCTION ON THE WEST END AND ON THE PROPERTY IMMIDIATELY EAST A HOTEL IS BEING BUILT THROUGH 2006. This means that unless you want a view of a construction site, your only bet is the middle-back of the hotel that overlooks the pool. Now if your room assigned does not have a working balcony as a result of the work being done, you are entitled to 5000 marriott points per night or a $100 food and beverage credit per night (sign upon checkin). This means that if you stay on the West side of the hotel where they are painting and renovating the outside and therefore your balcony is locked for safety and out of use, you are entitled. Unfortunately, if your balcony is functional (as was ours, although it overlooked a construction pit and 2- 100 foot cranes to the East. I am sadly not kidding), we did not apply for the credit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from celebrating our 30th anniversary in San Juan, Puerto Rico. We stayed at this Marriott on the recommendation of friends. The hotel is centrally located about 5 miles west of the airport and about 3 miles east of Old San Juan (don't miss Old San Juan, it is amazing, especially the fortifications). The Marriott is on a nice beach in an area densely built up with medium/high rise hotels and condos/apartments. The exterior of the hotel is well maintained but may appear dated to some discriminating travelers. It does blend into the surrounding buildings however as many of the buildings nearby are of the same vintage and most newer buildings are only slightly more modern in design. The interior has been recently redone to the tune of multiple millions of dollars and is quite nice. The entire lobby is a very large bar with a stage at one end where live music is performed most evenings. Check in is to the left and the casino is to the right. Check in lines can be long, but move quickly and check in staff is excellent. I asked for an upgrade, mentioning our 30th anniversary, but none were available. However, when we got to our room we found a nice note from the check in staff congratulating us on our anniversary on a tray with fruit, cheese and a bottle of wine that was of above average quality. Pretty classy for a Marriott. Our room was "ocean view" (see photo) and looked off to the west. Ocean front rooms face north. The room was decently sized, had a comfortable chair with a good reading light (you don't get those often enough) and was well maintained and very clean (and my wife is very, uh, picky, shall we say, when it comes to clean). The room service food (mostly from their "La Vista" restaurant) was well above average. We did not eat in their "high end" restaurant. The pools and beach were very nice. The casino was small, but adequate. My only complaint was that they only had one craps table and that didn't open until 8pm. My wife felt that was a plus, not a minus, however! A couple of quick notes: contrary to other comments here, my GPS worked fine and my Verizon cell phone worked fine too. You can call back to the USA as easily as calling your next door neighbor when you're at home. Roads are excellent, but very crowded around San Juan. Roads up in the hills and mountains are VERY serpentine. The Arecibo Observatory is closed on mondays and tuesdays (we found out the hard way). USA dollars are used and electricity is USA standard. Most people there speak some English, but knowing some Spanish is helpful. The road signs are in Spanish. Safety is no more an issue than it is in the USA. A little common sense there, as here, is always a good idea. One last note... my wife wanted the next book in a series she was reading so we went to a nearby bookstore. The books were in Spanish. Duh. They told us to go to the Borders book store in the mall for English books, so away we went. We found the mall without difficulty just off the highway a couple of miles south and were surprised to find that the mall was bigger and nicer than the malls at home! And we live in a good sized city (over one million people in our home town). You will also find Starbucks, Walgreens, Kmarts, etc. all around San Juan. It's quite like being in a Spanish speaking America! However, if you get out of San Juan, Puerto Rico is just another beautiful Caribbean island with plenty of island color and flavor. One last item: if you're in the mood for Italian, the Al Dente restaurant in Old San Juan is excellent.
reviews.title: 30th Anniversary Trip

reviews.text: I stayed two nights at this hotel the first week of April 2008. Many restaurants within walking distance. Well maintained hotel and very clean. Room was clean, bed nice and comfortable. Hotel restaurant was good and had a great Puerto Rican dinner buffet.
reviews.title: Very nice Marriott by the beach

reviews.text: We booked the Marriott San Juan, opting for a beach hotel over the boutique hotel in old San Juan. That turned out to be a big mistake, since the beaches were closed for our entire trip, due to high winds, making the pool area a total mob scene. Our rooms were very nice, with beautiful views of the ocean, extremely comfortable beds, and very nice bathrooms. The rooms were spotlessly clean, and we found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful. The problem? The common areas. Obviously it's a casino, and that should have tipped us off, but there's absolutely no quiet spot to have a glass of wine or a relaxed after dinner drink. The big, loud bar, which dominates the main floor, has a slightly sleazy feel, as does the casino. Yes, we played the slots and had fun with it, but, aside from our rooms, there was just nowhere to escape.
reviews.title: Disappointing

likes.liked: — Nicely appointed rooms, very comfortable beds, friendly service
likes.disliked: — No place to hide from the loud casino scene

reviews.text: Just returned from San Juan this weekend and had a very pleasant stay at the Marriott. My husband and I traveled with our 2 sons, 8 and 11. We arrived last Sunday, and we were pleasantly surprised by being able to check in early...I thought we'd be wandering around the hotel until around 4 pm, but we were in our room by 12 noon! That was great, as we changed and hit the beach. Yes, the water is ROUGH, but so much fun...my kids had so much fun riding in the waves that my husband and I joined in! It was a blast...I guess it could be dangerous for smaller children. The pool wasThe lobby was nice and there was a lot of activity there every night. It was not crowded when we were there, but I bet it gets very tight, as the tables are cramped together. I went to the casino for just about an hour, it was fine, but small.
reviews.title: pretty resort/great location

likes.liked: — convenient, close to airport, lots of restaurants in walking distance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We rented a car from Charlie's across the street for 3 days. It was great to be able to go back to Luquillo beach and even drove to Fajardo to Seven Seas beach. Both are gorgeous.! The restaurants in walking distance were all good. We were limited because of our kids, but we enjoyed Miro ( Spanish restaurant right across the street)..also, Piu Bella for breakfast and gelato was great. We liked Cafe de Angel, really good PR food, good prices.. Also, I would recommend Ummo, the argentinian grill down to the left. Had a great dinner there and it's a very stylish place. We went on a snorkeling trip with East Island Cats, recommended by the hotel and had a great trip. We took a "van" with a group of others to Fajardo to reach the catamaran. On the way there, our van got a flat...(really flat) we had to stop at a gas station...but they sent another van that was already at the marina to pick us up..they got there in 5 minutes, so it wasn't too bad. My kids thought it was quite the adventure. I was worried, but it worked out fine and I would recommend this trip. lots of fun!! I would recommend the Marriott, as a convenient location for walking to restaurants and having the Walgreens down the street. I think I would stay in Fajardo if I returned . it seems all the trips and the beaches are closer there than San Juan.
reviews.title: Wonderful! Fantastic! Magnificent!

reviews.text: We stayed at this wonderful hotel from August 27 to September 4. This has been out third stay in 4 years. We stood in 2007,2008 and now in 2010 and it just keep getting better and better.
reviews.title: Outstanding Great Hotel,Woderful Vacation,Will Stay Over Again Without a Doubt

reviews.text: I will like to say that I was a little concerned about staying at this hotel again when I was going to book my reservation back in May this year because of some negative reviews that I had been reading back then. I know that it is almost impossible to please every guest that stays at any given hotel because there will always be something that someone will pick on regardless how much the hotel will try to go out of their way to please their guests. I know this for a fact since I work more or less in the same type industry where I have to try to keep happy almost 1,000 tenants in a private owned complex of 21 buildings in Queens, New York and there is always someone who is never happy no matter how much you try to do so.
reviews.title: Not great but/and not awfull

reviews.text: However before making the reservation I decided to place a call to the hotel and speak to the Manager Representative Mr. Julian Cable Treadwell. He was not available at the time so I left him a message and within an hour Mr.Treadwell was nice enough to returned my phone call and we spoke for a few minutes. I expressed to him my concerns about the hotel and he assured that my concerns had been corrected and that I will enjoy once again my stay at the San Juan Marriott Resort. I have to admit that after speaking to Mr. Treadwell I felt so confident that I went ahead and booked my reservation to stay at the hotel for the third time.
reviews.title: A unique blend of business and resort makes this a special destination

reviews.text: It has been another great decision to stay here again. The complete hotel staff have always made us feel like family. From Willie and Gilbert (parking attendants) at the front when you arrive who always greet you with a wide smile and right away help you with your luggage. They make you feel as if you have come back to your home away from home.
reviews.title: Never, Ever Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't have to wait to check in. We went straight to the front desk and were met by Stephanie who had such a beautiful smile.She welcomed us to the hotel and helped us get the best room that we were pleased with. She was able to accomodate us on the 18th floor with a pool/ocean view room. She was so helpful and nice to us that we want to say , "thank you Stephanie."
reviews.title: Wonderful Trip

reviews.text: We stayed at the San Juan Marriott Resort and Stellaris Casino for one night on our way to the Dominican Republic for spring break. We arrived at 2pm and left the next morning at noon.
reviews.title: Pricey for a ghetto resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is no shuttle service to the hotel, which is probably 20 minutes from the airport. Exiting in the SJ airport, there appears to be a single cab company - or single tourism company that manages the cabs. They are in a little kiosk as soon as you exit the airport and they write up your itinerary (for the cab driver) and tell you the fare. Then you line up and get in a cab when it is your turn. Cab fare to the hotel for 4 of us with 4 suitcases and a golf bag was $18.50USD.
reviews.title: A+ in every area!
Good Service, Nice People
reviews.text: The hotel has a tall tower, maybe 20 floors, and then a 4-5 floor high wing (the "cabana" rooms). We requested a low floor in the tower because we had heard that the tower rooms had been renovated already but the cabana rooms had not. We were put in a tower room on the 18th floor, overlooking the pool and the ocean. The room was nicely decorated and clean, and had a new flat screen tv.

The beach in this area has tan/brown sand. The water is bright blue/green. The pool at the resort is very nice and has a little water slide and swim up bar. They are obviously trying very hard to be a resort. The problem is that the area surrounding the hotel beachfront is all either graffitied and run-down, or under construction. Maybe eventually it will get cleaned up but we were really not enticed to walk along the beach, for example.
reviews.title: Nice and friendly
Fantastic Family Vacation
reviews.text: This does not stop them from having resort prices. Our room was about $400 for the night (+/- tax) for a single room with two double beds. Hamburgers at the pool grill were $12, a bottle of corona was $5. The Vista restaurant in the hotel offered a lunch buffet for $22 per person and a breakfast buffet for $17. We did not do either and didn't even check the dinner prices.

Unlike most of my travels, this one was for a vacation. Overall this was a great experience, and the hotel took very good care of us. I am giving it 4/5, but there were a couple of small complaints I had:
reviews.title: Great hotel, fantastic view!

reviews.text: 1) The map of nearby restaurants that the concierge desk gave us had some errors on it with respect to certain restaurant locations. This is a *very* minor complaint but I am including it here so that others will not be surprised.
reviews.title: Great time with the kids!

reviews.text: 2) The most expensive meal we ate during our entire vacation was the breakfast buffet one of the morning we were there. Don't get me wrong, the food is great, but it is WAY overpriced at $30 per person.
reviews.title: liar,liar,your pants are on fire

reviews.text: As for the positives, they were just overwhelming!
reviews.title: We'll be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) What a magnificent view!
reviews.title: Nice stay average property in need of updates on grounds

reviews.text: We were in San Juan for 5 days for a quick family vacation. We were very pleased with the Marriott. We chose this hotel because we wanted to be walking distance from restaurants, near the airport, and we had some Marriott rewards points for a free night.
reviews.title: First trip to Puerto Rico
Okay stay, not impressed
reviews.text: We did not spend much time at the pool. It was crowded most of the daytime and there were lots of families (which doesn't bother us because we travel with our kids). The kiddie pool is large in comparison to the regular pool. The regular pool has a volleyball net running across it, fountains and a slide.

We spent most of our time on the beach and it was great. Very peaceful. The red flag was up the entire time, although the water didn't seem all that rough until the last day or 2 when it became more choppy and there were some rain showers. The beach was sandy, no rocks or shells to speak of. We spent our last day at the pool. By then the hotel had emptied out and the weather was iffy. It was very pleasant without the crowds. It's also nice at the pool in the evenings.
reviews.title: A Fair Review of SJM
Marriott -not bad not great
reviews.text: I can't speak for wait-service at the pool or beach since we didn't order any drinks, but in general we found the staff to be pleasant and helpful. The bellhops were particularly friendly, and offer water bottles (free) when returning from jogging.

We ate breakfast at the buffet our first day. There weren't lines at the omelet station but the omelet cook did move quite slowly compared to the same at other Marriotts. One night we ate at Tuscany's. They had a $20 prix fix special between 6 and 7. This was great value although the choices are limited and some of the portions small depending on the choice. The food and atmosphere are very nice. We aslo ate at some nearby places, that for the most part were OK. Breakfast at Danny's Int'l (exit hotel to the left and walk a few blocks) was very good and very inexpensive. There's also an Italian place across from Danny's (I think called Via Appia Deli), that had decent pizza and salads. The Mexican place near the Italian was pleasant in ambience but the food was nothing special (the margarita's were good).
reviews.title: Run down and horrible
Not great 2/25/05
reviews.text: Just returned from the hotel today. The hotel Lobby is unbearable at night. The live bands they have are soo loud you cannot hear yourself think. There is not one place you can go to escape the pounding of the music. Not even small seating areas scattered about. The outside of the building where the beach is located is all under construction. There is graffiti on the adjacent buildings. The buildings that surround the Marriot are all under heavy construction. While on the beach you can watch the crane move heavy pieces of metal around. The staff is okay if you do not ask for anything too complicated. Most of the time they just smile and say yes no matter what you are asking. The staff is generally nice and are trying to please. The food prices are ok, and the food is just ok. There is not a lot for kids to do. At night there is actualy nothing for them to do. It's probably a two star property. If you look close at the details they are just ok. IE:
Cracked marble pieces, shower stall with rusted hadnles to the shower, moldings by elevators that are broken, carpet with stains, etc..
reviews.title: Overall A Great Hotel
Nice Vacation
reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriott for 2 nights pre-cruise. The room was nice (but not amazing) with a spectacular view of the beach. The hotel was a lot of fun. The casino was great, and the salsa in the hotel lobby was very entertaining. Overall the service was very good too. My one complaint is with the service in the restaurant. It was really terrible! We sat one day for nearly 10 minutes before someone greeted us. They should do something to improve service there. I would definitely stay here again.

Went in january. Hotel was nice. Outside to the left and rifght there not a lot, except some local stores, there is a Starbucks, Walgrens etc., a lot of graffitti all over the place. We liked Tijuannas Mexican restaurant to the left of the hotel down a block and there is a pizza place next to it that was good. The rain forest and the fort werent much as far as I was concerned and old juan didnt see anything good about that trip either, the cruise ships dock there and its run down, of age I guess, but again a lot of graffitti all over !
reviews.title: Good Experience at the Marriott
Good place for kids
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed at the San Juan Marriott Resort on Condado Beach from October 21-27, 2004. We enjoyed ourselves tremendously. I'm from NY and I spend a lot of time in NYC, so I barely noticed the sound of the construction next door. I can see how it would bother some people, though. The room was very clean and the staff very pleasant, so overall we have no complaints.
Reading some of the other reviews it doesn't seem possible we were at the same place - except I know where I stayed.
reviews.title: Awful area

reviews.text: Room check in was delayed by hours past the 4:00 check in. We were given a $50. credit for the delay.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant Trip

reviews.text: Elevators were very slow. Concierge level ammenities were great, food available - times open and the view from the patio at sunset .
reviews.title: Nice urban oasis

reviews.text: Room appeared to be updated. It was clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spa is 3 tiny rooms located right next to the work out floor of the gym. The loud music all but defeated any attempt to relax.
reviews.title: Everything we wanted for our Honeymoon

reviews.text: Restaurant recommendations- Ajili Mojili right down the street from the hotel. La Mallorquina (old world charm) and the Parrot Club (trendy and colorful) in Old San Juan. All three have great food.
reviews.title: Great Pre-cruise Stop

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 10 day stay at the Marriot. Used to live in PR but no family left in the island so decided to stay at an hotel rather than an empty house. The Marriot exceeded all my expectations. The service is excellent. Puerto Ricans are a very friendly people in general and this shows, always asking if everything was ok and always greeting you with a friendly smile. I had a corner room (#1609) overlooking the ocean and pool/Old San Juan. The corner rooms have a wrap around terrace in which easily you could entertain over 10 people. they have chairs and a table so you can watch the spectacular sunsets from your terrace while enjoying a drink or simply relaxing. The business lounge at the 21st floor is very nice also, they have appetizers from 5-730pm (Sunday-Thursday) which can easily serve as a meal. In the morning they also have breakfast which I found more than adequate. There's an automatic coffee machine also which makes excellent espresso. The beach: perfect also. Included in the price is a "resort fee" which allows you to use the hotel beach chairs and umbrellas. So you only have to tell the attendant at the beach where you want your chair and umbrella and thats it, no $$ involved. Most of the time I was there the beach was half empty but on weekends you find more locals that stay at the hotel and can be more crowded but never too crowded.
reviews.title: Super customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a long weekend in San Juan. We chose San Juan because it was a quick getaway and a direct, non-stop flight from Hartford. We stayed at the Marriott San Juan and Stellaris Casino in the Condado section. We have been to several islands and while this was not the best we've ever been to, it was a perfect long weekend. The area seems to be under a sort of rebuilding phase and there are several new hotels being built. The Marriott was extremely clean, which I loved. The rooms were impeccable and the staff was incredibly friendly. Take a cab from the airport - which is 10 minutes away - and it's only $16 or so. Definitely cab to Old San Juan to see the beautiful buildings, narrow streets and old forts.
reviews.title: Would totally recommend

reviews.text: We stay at this hotel every year for the last 10 years. The people are friendly. We have so much fun! We would never stay anywhere else!!
reviews.title: Love it

likes.liked: — I love the area, the hotel and the people!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriott from Wednesday May 7 through Saturday May 10, 2008 and had a first floor pool view room which was perfect since we had a 2-year old that napped in the afternoons. We had no significant issues, room was great but we were not there to sit in our room. Bed was very comfortable. Overall the stay was above average and would suggest it to anyone. We were also there during the week when it was not so crowded but did start to get more crowded on Friday and Saturday morning.
reviews.title: Great Time

reviews.text: Pools and Beach. There are 2 pools and one is 2 to 2.5 feet deep which is perfect for small children that cannot swim yet. Yes, there are problems getting sun in the morning but the beach has plenty of sun in the morning. By the way, I have read all the reviews about the rough surf - it is a beach and there are waves, nothing more than any other beach I have been. The sand is great and clean, plenty of chairs.
reviews.title: Marriott Not up to Par

likes.liked: — the location of the hotel in the Condado Beach area

reviews.title: We loved our honeymoon!!!
reviews.text: Food. We did not eat at any of the hotel restaurants as pricey. We did eat the hot dogs ($6) and hamburgers ($12) from the hotel which were good for hotel pool food. There are plenty of places up and down the street from the hotel including the Gelato place for breakfast - $20 for 2 adults and kid. Danni's and the Itialian wine bar - great pizza and good wine prices. We got pizza from the Itialian place and wine from the grocery store (2 blocks down from hotel to the left) and sat by the pool o eat - best meal of the entire trip. We also bought snacks and beer (Medialia is the native Puerto Rico beer and quite good) at the grocer store.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its by far the best hotel in Condado. My husband and I stayed 6 nights and we were thrilled with our decision. The staff was so friendly and helpful,the hotel was really clean (and they they were renovating the lobby) and our room was fantastic - you really couldnt ask for better service. We would definately go back.
reviews.title: Great Service!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for two nights prior to a cruise ship departure out of San Juan. We were looking for something nice that had a resort-style pool and beach but was not too far out of the way from the airport, cruise ship terminals, and tourist attractions. Overall, we were pleased with our selection and didn't notice any other hotel properties that we wished we'd selected instead.
reviews.title: Good choice for short stay in San Juan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had one meal in the Tuscany restaurant in the hotel. The restaurant was not very busy while we were there, and the service was slow and part of our order was forgotten, but the entrees were delicious. Our reservation Included breakfast for two, which was a full buffet and also very good. The beach was just a few steps from the hotel, clean, with chairs and umbrellas. We were a little disappointed in the pool area - it was small and had a run-down feeling so we settled on the beach instead. Taxis were always readily available and there was a handy pavillion across the street that included a Starbucks, Ben & Jerrys, and a couple of restaurants. There was construction going on in the lobby, which resulted in a little confusion when we arrived but will be resolved when it is completed.
reviews.title: Excellent property, service and amenities

reviews.text: Overall, we were pleased with our stay and will definitely consider this hotel on our next trip to San Juan.
reviews.title: A beautiful property in San Juan (Condado)

reviews.text: In the heart of Condado is this Marriott. From the moment we were greeted with a warm smile and cold champagne, everything was fantastic. A nicely decorated, clean corner room with floor to ceiling windows with one side overlooking the city and the other side overlooking the ocean and balconies on both sides to enjoy - I was ecstatic. Room 923.
reviews.title: I love San Juan and Marriott

reviews.text: my best friend and i stayed @ the marriott last summer and i have 2 say that the room was great. the service was wonderful, the beach was very nice, but the casino was OFF THE HOOK. lol. if you are going to relax, and don't want 2 do the party scene, then this is the place for you. but if you are looking for something more "wild", then you should stay else where. you should definetely eat outside of the hotel. step out of your shell and into the town. Cafe Angels is right down the block and the food is incredible. it's inexpensive and the staff is more than friendly.
reviews.title: loved the marriott
very nice
reviews.text: Very nice room, ocean view. Pleased with the rate. On site Restaurant a bit pricey but location great for walking to local restaurants. Close to San Juan by public bus. Good area for sight seeing. Beautiful pool. Nice beach, very strong undertoe even on a windless clear day. Overall, pretty happy with hotel and facilities. Would definately stay here again.

reviews.title: No regrets, but will stay elsewhere next time
reviews.text: We were married sisters on a short vacation, stayed 5 nights. Room was nice, clean, and interesting view (16th floor) of both ocean and city. Yes, there is a lot of construction - but it's everywhere, not just around the Marriott. We enjoyed the 15 minutes/25-cent bus ride to Old San Juan, and you can board just one block from the hotel. The hotel seemed more appropriate for business travelers, and is definitely not where you want to be for a "beach" vacation - I would go out of town (Luquillo beach was beautiful) for that. Since we wanted to sightsee, we found the location to be fine, but there were several boutique hotels in the same area, for 1/3 the price, and including breakfast. The beach is public and easily accessed from anwhere along Ashford Ave, and you can rent a beach chair for $2. We chose Marriott since this was our first time to Puerto Rico, but now I know I can get good value for much less cost. You are paying for lobby entertainment, access to casino, and on-site restaurants. We only ate at the hotel once, for breakfast. There are great restaurants within walking distance - our favorite was the Waikiki, about 5 blocks west.

reviews.title: Nice hotel but see comments
reviews.text: Just got back from 3 days at the San Juan marriot and Casino in Condado Beach area. The hotel is very nice and the staff more than friendly and helpful, room was great, on 16th floor, oceanfront, nice shampoo's etc, lots of towels, mini bar, coffee maker, safe, hair dryer and nice comforters and sheets. The beach is clean but the waves were very rough, couldnt swim, red flag out every day. Plenty of sun one day, rained the other 2 days but warm, in 80's. The pool is not heated. This hotel is very nice but along the strip there is nothning but construction and buildings with graffitti all over, same with old San Juan, graffatti all over and looked really run down, I know its old but so are a lot of places I have been. Went to to the fort in old juan, I didnt think it was worth the trip, but my opinion.

reviews.title: Off The Chain
reviews.text: We ate breakfast and lunch 2 days at the hotel, not great but ok. Pool bar has some eats and good drinks, gets busy in mid day, 2 outside pool bars/grills and one hotel bar in the lobby. We also ate across the street, to the left and down about a block, a Mexican place called Tijuanas, great margaritas and can eat outside, also a pizza place right next to it which was good and also could eat outside.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed 4 days 3 nights for a pre-crusie vacation. We absolutely loved it!! We stayed on the 16th floor with an ocean view room that was gorgeous. It was newly renovated and based on the receptionist at the check in window we were the 4th guest to stay in the room. The hotel was very clean and the cleaning crew was very respectful to the items we left in plain view on the dresser.
reviews.title: Loved Puerto Rico!

likes.liked: — The staff and the cleanliness of the rooms

reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.text: Food: we ate at The Vista every morning for free due to upgrading our room from city view to ocean view....totally worth it!!! However, if we had not had the free breakfast we probably wouldn't have ate at the hotel. It was very expensive and the selection got old after a few days. However, we did try a good chicken sandwich offered by the pool bar.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Drinks: The drinks served by the bar at the pool are pretty pricey and not very strong. However, if you go into the bar in the lobby they seem to taste stronger.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

likes.liked: — There were no crowds - it was off season
likes.disliked: — Lack of shopping around the hotel

reviews.text: Nightlife: We really enjoyed the fact that we did not need to leave the hotel to have a good time. While we were there they had a Brazilian night with professional dancers, a live band, salsa night and a DJ. We sat at the bar a few nights to enjoy the entertainment.
reviews.title: Unexpectedly nice… great for business, wouldn’t spend a week on vacation here.
San Juan- Imagine having Vegas,SouthBeach, & Acapulco all in one place!!!
reviews.text: Just returned from San Juan 2 days ago (March 23) and stayed at the Marriot in Condado and I am missing it terribly!!! The people there are so friendly it is unreal. If they were that nice in the states they would be taken advantage of in about 2.3 seconds to say the least. My friends and I made friends with some locals the first day we arrived and hung out with them every day we were there. They showed us their puerto rico which was the best experience. We partied all night and afterwards went to the beach to watch the sun come up almost every day. Oooh and I also learned a new drink receipe called Lemoncillo. The spelling may not be right but its water, bacardi 151, and crystal light. You do not taste the 151 and its sooooo good but it can sneak up on you if your not careful.

reviews.title: San Juan and the Marriott Stellaris great for whole family!
reviews.text: Here is a a quick guide to the nightlife:
Thursdays: Babylon/Moorings
reviews.title: Had a great time

reviews.text: Friday's: Babylon / 360 / Element / Senor Frogs/ Outside bar next to Condado Plaza/Moorings
reviews.title: Perfect Choice for Condado

reviews.text: Saturday's: Babylon/ Ochos de Blanco/ Moorings
reviews.title: Good if you don't want to sleep or be in your room

reviews.text: After reading some bad reviews, I was hesitant to choose this hotel for our stay, but I am glad I did. I found the hotel to be clean, the staff helpful, and we checked in early with no problem. The housekeeping staff did a great job everyday and were super friendly. When we called up for extra towels, someone was right there within minutes. The hotel was right on the beach, and the bar was great. We tried the lounge and the drinks, music, and atmosphere were great there too. I thought our stay here was a great value, and it even included 2 free breakfast bars everyday, which was a great value. I recommend this hotel. It was great for our stay, and we didn't have any problems!
reviews.title: Great stay - would stay again !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from a 4-night stay at the Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casino, and we had a wonderful time! The hotel was easy to get to with a taxi from the airport ($15 each way). The lobby is beautiful. Check in was a breeze and the woman at the reception desk was very helpful. We loved our ocean-front room. We were a little bummed we didn't get a king size bed, we got two double's instead, but it wasn't a big deal. The beds were super comfortable and appreciated other comforts such as in-room robes, coffee and water.
reviews.title: Great stay in San Juan!

reviews.text: We loved the swim-up bar! Drinks are a little expensive. $9 for a Pina Colada. But, we felt that it was worth it to have a fun drink in the pool or at the beach. Staff graciously hands out complimentary towels and bring chairs and umbrellas out on the beach for you. They had a DJ playing in the early evening (during happy hour especially) which could be a little loud. Not ideal for reading a book and relaxing, but can be fun. If you want to relax/read a book, you can do it during the day when the DJ isn't playing.
reviews.title: If you dont like mold and mildew stay away

reviews.text: We didn't eat at the hotel because there are a ton of great restaurants on Ashford Avenue. Miro (across the street from the hotel) and recommended by the concierge was our favorite.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: There was some construction going on during our stay, but that's to be expected since we visited in the "off season."
reviews.title: Wonderful Vacation

aka: Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris Hotel
description: Only five miles from Luis Munoz International Airport, located in the prestigious Condado neighborhood of San Juan in a highly desirable beachfront location only minutes from numerous restaurants and bars.The property boasts 513 spacious guest rooms and 12 suites, most with spectacular Atlantic Ocean views; the 24 hour Stellaris Casino on site, two outdoor pools, two lighted tennis courts and Ocean Club Wellness Center that features a wide array of massages and treatments in addition to the health club.Food & Beverage offerings include La Vista Latin Grill, La Isla Beach Bar & Grill, La Isla Pool Bar, Wan Chai Noodle Bar, Coffee Merchant and the ultra chic Red Coral Lounge.Come and enjoy the comfortand atmosphere of everything this "Caribbean Cosmoplitan Beach Club" has to offer.
